trans-unit.source: xPath Values in Azure
trans-unit.target: xPath Values in Azure

trans-unit.source: Starting with Azure SDK 1.5 you can use the xPath element in a web role or a worker role service definition file to retrieve runtime configuration values.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Azure SDK 1.5 you can use the xPath element in a web role or a worker role service definition file to retrieve runtime configuration values.

trans-unit.source: The following table represents the supported xPath values and their functional equivalent in the Service Runtime API.
trans-unit.target: The following table represents the supported xPath values and their functional equivalent in the Service Runtime API.

trans-unit.source: xPath Purpose
trans-unit.target: xPath Purpose

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Determine whether the deployment is running on in the compute emulator or on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Determine whether the deployment is running on in the compute emulator or on Azure.

trans-unit.source: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/Deployment/@emulated"
trans-unit.target: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/Deployment/@emulated"

trans-unit.source: Using the @emulated location path for the deployment is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:
trans-unit.target: Using the @emulated location path for the deployment is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <externalLink><linkText>RoleEnvironment Class</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.serviceruntime.roleenvironment.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <externalLink><linkText>RoleEnvironment Class</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.serviceruntime.roleenvironment.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the deployment ID for the instance.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the deployment ID for the instance.

trans-unit.source: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/Deployment/@id"
trans-unit.target: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/Deployment/@id"

trans-unit.source: Using the @id location path for the deployment is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:
trans-unit.target: Using the @id location path for the deployment is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:

trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <externalLink><linkText>RoleEnvironment Class</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.serviceruntime.roleenvironment.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the current role ID for the instance.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the current role ID for the instance.

trans-unit.source: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/CurrentInstance/@id"
trans-unit.target: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/CurrentInstance/@id"

trans-unit.source: Using the @id location path for the current instance is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:
trans-unit.target: Using the @id location path for the current instance is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:

trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <externalLink><linkText>RoleEnvironment Class</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.serviceruntime.roleenvironment.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the update domain of the instance.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the update domain of the instance.

trans-unit.source: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/CurrentInstance/@updateDomain"
trans-unit.target: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/CurrentInstance/@updateDomain"

trans-unit.target: Using the @updateDomain location path for the current instance is functionally equivalent to the follow statement:

trans-unit.target: Retrieves the role name of the instances.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the value of the specified configuration setting.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the value of the specified configuration setting.

trans-unit.target: xpath="/RoleEnvironment/CurrentInstance/ConfigurationSettings/ConfigurationSetting[@name='Setting1']/@value"
